column3: The Ananta battlemaid is not one to be trifled with.
You look like a ssstrider in sssearch of comrades in need. If ssso, I have a tasssk for you.

I am a trainer, and I was told to expect new recruitsss thisss <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>eve<Else/>day</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>eve</If></If>, yet nary a one has come. Perhapsss they were given the wrong time or location. I do not know.
They number five in all, these would-be warriors. Sssend them unto me, should you chance to find them.
With time, I can turn even the most haplesss milksssops into whirlwinds of death. But I cannot do thisss if sssaid farmboys do not come.
Oh bugger, you were sent by the snake, weren't you!? I heard one in four recruits doesn't live through their training. That can't be true, right? Oh bugger, oh bugger...

Ah. A thousand pardons. So preoccupied was I by the question of whether Ala Mhigo should be a monarchy or republic that I neglected to attend my training. How silly, I know─until we drive the imperials from our lands, the question is moot.
I know, I know. I'm late. But I had to say a prayer for my sister first. After what the imperials did to her, death was a mercy...
Huh? Training? Gah! I was so busy practicing to impress the others that I completely forgot! Thank you!
The teacher calls for me? I see. We were discussing strategies for disabling magitek armor, you see, and... Ah, yes, of course, there is no time. If you would excuse me.
All recruitsss are presssent and accounted for. My thanksss to you, ssstrider.
Not all appreciate the rigor with which I train my recruitsss. Sssome favor a gentler approach. As if the imperials will be ssso kind.
'Tis a thanklesss job, to teach, sssome sssay. But I sssay their sssurvival is thanksss enough. Fare you well.
